node.title: Hertz customers: We were arrested, jailed over false theft reports
node.description: More people have come forward to claim they were accused, arrested and even jailed after Hertz reported cars they had legitimately rented were stolen.
node.content: ["More people have come forward to claim they were accused, arrested or even jailed after Hertz reported cars\u00a0they had legitimately rented were stolen. \u00a0", "Carrie Gibbs was arrested at a California gas station in 2019 after Hertz told police she'd stolen the truck.\u00a0\u00a0 \u00a0\u00a0The truck had been rented for her from Hertz by an insurance company after an accident, but police took her to jail, and she was charged with felony car theft. \u00a0\u00a0", "The case was later dismissed but Gibbs said in court papers she lost her real estate license for a year.\u00a0", "\"I've been a real estate agent for 18 years. So this is the most frustrating thing ever,\" Gibbs told CBS News' consumer investigative correspondent Anna Werner.\u00a0", "A NASA employee claims he was also targeted after Hertz reported his vehicle stolen. According to him, he was driving a rented Hertz SUV when a Florida police officer held him at gun point after Hertz filed a theft report two days earlier, claiming the vehicle NASA had rented was stolen. \u00a0", "He was later released and has also filed a claim against the rental company. \u00a0", "Another claimant, Florida banker Manuel Garcia, said he watched as his Hertz rental car was towed away while he was at a restaurant after it was also reported it stolen\u2014even though he said he had been leasing the car for months.\u00a0", "\"Never in my life would I imagine that I would be in a situation like this,\" Garcia said. \u00a0", "Carmen Bosko rented a car from a Florida Hertz location in January and said she returned it in April. But in August, officers in Georgia arrested her for car theft. Bosko spent 40 days in jail and was separated from her three children including her two-month-old baby. \u00a0", "\"I had to explain to my kids why I was gone for 40 days. And I missed time with my youngest that I'll never get back,\" she said. \u00a0\u00a0", "Steven Robinson told CBS News he never even rented a car from Hertz. But in June, police arrested him for car theft. He spent two days in jail and is now being prosecuted on felony charges. \u00a0", "\"I mean, this was the worst experience ever in my life. And I can't believe that Hertz and it was a good slogan I heard, but Hertz really hurts people. Their negligent practices is like, it's terrible,\" said Robinson. \u00a0", "Another person, Rejeana Meado, said she rented a Hertz car for three days in May to attend a wedding in Houston with her husband. She claims she returned it on time. \u00a0 \u00a0", "But last week, Hertz sent her this email saying they have now reported the car stolen, meaning she could face charges and now lives in fear she will be arrested. \u00a0", "\"I have a husband. I have kids. It's terrible. Sorry... My doorbell rings and I am fearful that it is the cops coming to get me,\" Meado said. \u00a0", "Hertz would not comment on this report but has previously said the \"vast majority\" of cases \"involve renters who were many weeks or even months overdue returning vehicles and who stopped communicating with (Hertz) well beyond the scheduled due date.\"\u00a0", "CBS News has previously reported on similar claims after a bankruptcy court judge was set to hear arguments. Attorney Francis Alexander Malofiy said since CBS News' report first aired, more people are coming forward.\u00a0", "\"People think that they're an isolated incident and they don't realize that this is a systemic issue that's happening across the nation,\" Malofiy said. \u00a0", "Hertz disputes that, saying \"situations where vehicles are reported to the authorities are very rare.\"\u00a0", "Fritz Jekel filed a similar case in 2019 and at the time asked Hertz whether there were any other lawsuits for false arrests and similar claims. He said he got back a database, containing over 300 claims filed, going all the way back to 2008-2016.\u00a0", "CBS News was not able to view the database because Hertz has marked it confidential. Hertz did not answer our questions about that database. \u00a0", "In a previous statement, Hertz said it \"cares deeply about our customers, and we successfully provide rental vehicles for tens of millions of travelers each year.\"\u00a0", "For Breaking News & Analysis Download the Free CBS News app"]
